content.detailedDescription:
my friend steve and i were waiting for one of our friend, jacqui to come over. we decided to go out and sit on the deck as it was a great evening, and we are stargazers by nature so this wasn't out of the ordinary. we had been sitting out there for some time when jacqui had arrived, and we all moved out to the deck. 
   it was a pretty typical night just discussing the days events, and so on, and jacqui and i went inside for no more than a minute when steve was urgently calling me back outside. he kept saying "its a ufo, its a real ufo, hurry hurry hurry". i got very excited and rushed outside, to see a very bright low flying object. i'm assuming it was low flying because of the size of it, looking up into the night sky it was as big around as my index finger meeting my thumb at full stretch. it had the qualities of a star when you looked at it, it didn't really have a definite color to it, it just sort of twinkled. it moved very silently, which we both thought was odd considering how low it seemed to be flying. we watched it for almost 2 minutes trying to figure out what it was, and i had serious chills running down my back. it both frightened me because i didn't know what it was, all the meanwhile finally seeing what i'd always hoped to see. 
   after about 2 minutes, it literally seemed to dissipate into the stars, the large object gradually got smaller, but at an astonishingly quick rate, still remaining silent. when i saw that happen i literally had to sit down because my eyes couldn't believe what they saw. it was absolutely incredible and frankly i couldn't be happier to have seen it. i only wish i had more time to get out a camera.
content.summary: Bright starlike object passes by and zooms into the stars

content.detailedDescription: My family and i were watching a firework display. we saw an unknown object flash the colors amber,red and white during the display. the object was high in altitude and moved slowly towards the fireworks. we observed the ufo until we lost our visual through the thick clouds of smoke after the display.
content.summary: Fireworks &ufo

content.detailedDescription:
I had just put our car in the garage and, as i was walking back towards the house, i spotted two orange lights moving at speed through the sky.  they were closer than a plane would have been, were much faster and were silent. also there were no flashing lights, so they were definitely not planes or helicopters.  they were heading a north-westerly direction and i saw them to the south of my house, they ended up being obscured by the trees.
i ran into the house to grab my camcorder (which was upstairs) and told my fiancee what i had just seen.  we looked out of the window and another single light orange flew past, before i had the chance to turn on my camera.  this was also flying in the same direction and got obscured by the trees.
i went outside with my camcorder and saw another orange light to the north of my house (quite some distance from where the other ones originiated), it was also heading the same direction.  i managed to get some brief footage of it, which gives a sense of the speed it was travelling.  i tried to zoom in on it but lost focus, got it back in focus again then it was obscured by the roof of our house.
at first i thought they were ufo's; then i thought they may have been meteorites - but there wasn't a tail at all. i looked online and saw stories of chinese lanterns however these 4 lights were moving rapidly and the final one came from a totally different direction than the others.
i stayed outside for another 30 minutes or so scanning the sky but didn't see any other lights.  from the other descriptions i have seen online it seems that people in the usa saw exactly the same lights within about 20 minutes of me seeing them in the uk.
content.summary: Orange lights moving through the sky at speed

content.detailedDescription: I already posted this but now have the two pictures we managed to get (i wanted to get permission from the person who took it).  i am still stunned, especially since there are now hundreds of postings with similar pictures, videos from all over the world.
content.summary: Pink/orange spherical objects initially in triangle formation with many to follow

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were on our way home from a friend's house on highway 30, heading toward baker city from haines. we were coming toward the intersection of highway 30 and 10th street when i noticed a light on the other side of the valley, toward the east, on the opposite side of i84. i pointed it out to my wife, and she thought it was strange too. when then noticed two other lights climbing after it. they were amber in color, and we ruled them out as planes because they were ascending at a 90 degree angle, and none of the lights were flashing. we parked our car on the side of hughes lane to observe the lights some more. the lights then formed what appeared to  be an equilateral triangle, they then one by one slowly dimmed in succession until they were no longer visible. we were both puzzled by this. we could tell that the lights were not satellites because when we first noticed them, they were against a hill. they later climbed above the horizon. this is the second sighting in the baker valley this week.
content.summary: Three bright amber lights climbing into the sky, forming an equilateral triange, disappearing one by one.

content.detailedDescription: I just let my dog out at 1040 pm. i was standing on the back patio when i seen a orange and yellow object in the sky to the south it was moving to the north. then i seen the second one right behind it and a little to the east. i tried to call a friend but no answer. i went into the house to get a camera. this time i went out the front of the house. i couldn't get a pic they were to far away. then i seen two more glowing balls to the south moving north. not sure what they were never seen anything like it before. they looked like fireballs they seemed to be moving at a good rate of speed.
content.summary: Two sets of two glowing balls

content.detailedDescription:
My fiance and i were sitting outside stargazing/satellite hunting at my parent's house in mont clare, pa at approximately 10:30 pm on july 9, 2011. current weather conditions for the area were clear skies with little to no wind. the moon was bright and nearly full. (according to moonphaseinfo.Com, in the 'waxing gibbous' phase.)

my dad was looking northeast and first noticed the objects, shouting: "look at all these lights! go get your binoculars!"  (my fiance and i are avid birdwatchers.) all of us had sight of them near the constellation of the big dipper.

we have no idea what the objects were. even when viewing through binoculars we could not make out any distinguishing shapes. afterwards, i wondered if it was space debris from shuttle atlantis. 

first impression from all of us was that there were so many of these mysterious lights. the lights were as bright as a star or satellite and the same size.  no one did an official count but - at best guess - there were approximately 30 lights traveling in a mostly southern direction in a cluster across the sky.  the best way i can describe the objects is that they reminded me of a cluster of balloons. interestingly, the lights traveled together in a northeast-southwest direction the entire time we had sight of them but the spacing between the indiviual lights changed constantly; some drifted apart from each other for several seconds before coming back together. when focusing on a few lights at a time with my binoculars, they appeared to flicker like a strobelight.  none of the lights veered completely off course. there was no sound at all.

we hoped that others witnessed and reported this sighting and that there will be a reporting on the local news.  we were amazed and a little freaked out, but mostly curious.  afterwards, we were frustrated that we didn't think to capture the event with a camera or video.  more than anything, we just want to know what it was that we saw. 

we lost sight of the objects as they traveled toward the direction of the moon.
content.summary: Cluster of approx. 30 lights moving across sky of southeastern pennsylvania

content.detailedDescription: I live on a hill, in an area where i have an impressive view of the city and a window that takes up my entire wall. i was sitting on my bed on my laptop. around 7:00 pm, i glanced out my window and saw what i initially thought was a plane, because i saw a light on it's tail end. i got up to get a closer look and watched it fly over the city slowly before stopping in midair and disappearing. it hovered for maybe a minute before completely vanishing; it didn't get smaller like it was going off into the distance, it just vanished.
content.summary: Silver cigar floated across the city and then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: Upon exiting my garage to enter the house, i stepped onto my back stoop. i looked up and to my right toward the northern sky (i'm not certain what drew my attention) and then immediately i observed three bright amber orbs in an isosceles triangle formation.  only sky was apparent between the orbs.  the triangle/orbs slowly, silently moved roughly w-nw in the direction of us 41.  the object(s) were north of my location at an indeterminate distance in the sky, although the size of the triangle form suggested a relatively low-flying orbs or very massive if a high-flying 'solid' craft; i could not discern which.  the triangle shape seemed tilted, perhaps 15-20 degrees, with the northern-most orb lower. i called to my wife and sister-in-law, whom were in the house, to come out and see. we observed the orbs for a brief period, perhaps no more than thirty seconds, while the orbs gradually (perhaps 6-7 seconds per orb), individually dimmed and seemed to "go out" beginning with the most distant, followed by the "front", narrow end, and finally the 'closest'.  the orbs did not stop their slow w-nw movement during this period.  i walked a short distance down the alley behind the house because a large tree obscured my vision of the sky within which the object(s) would have moved if they had followed the same trajectory after going out; however, i saw only stars.  there was no sign of the object(s), no contrails, smoke, vapor, clouds, only stars.  despite the brevity of this sighting, these orbs did not appear to be conventional aircraft, stars, planets, flares, fireworks or distant lights from structures.  there was smoke, no differential intensity of light besides the controlled dimming effect, and they did not seem to lose altitude or distortion of overall shape.  the orbs moved in conjunction as if attached to a solid triangular shape or as if flying in a steady formation.  i had no unusual sensations or thoughts during the sighting, only curiosity and then astonishment.  i did not have time to grab my camera or cell phone to get a picture.
content.summary: Slowly moving bright amber orbs forming an isosceles triangle; lights dimmed and disappeared uniformily and in succession

content.detailedDescription: My friend and i were in my apartment and she said "what is that?" she said it seem to come out of the sky all of a sudden, not from somewhere in the sky, but like out of a wormhole. so we went out on my patio and in the sky we saw a fireball like thing.  at first i thought of a plane unfire.   but it kept moving and was really moving fast.  it was not like it was being carried by the wind.  it was moving to fast.  i called my brother who in mufon and he thought of a chinese lantern.  i dont think so as it was moving to fast.  it was very bright red and the fire was pulsating like a fire would be.  not just a fire in the chinese lantern. what ever it was was sure unfire and really moving.  we were really scared because we thought someone was in trouble, and also why was it suddenly appearing like that?
content.summary: Red fire in sky moving quickly from east to north west about 2000 feet in the sky not slowly

content.detailedDescription:
At 9:20 pm colombian time, i'm in my apartment when i get to go to the balcony & obcervo a rare item i was not a plane at that nose helicopters for a move or so it was very high. the object was moving from side to side had a yellow and red. hard to 2 min and at any moment the object in a circle desaparese without explanation.
the first reaction i had was a star, so he was still for a few seconds. but after that began to titiliar colors like yellow and blue moving from side to side, obviously not of this planet sec then disappeared. i have seen videos of ufos and stuff like that because as i intereza the subject but what i saw today was not anything i've seen on tv and programs. i've never seen something so rare, but then my mother also was present estava impacted. it was a plane at that nose not move a elicptero by altitude.
content.summary: Sphere-shaped, circle exactly flash different colors yellow and blue. to horizontal moviemiento

content.detailedDescription:
I was at a park in mt. shasta, california. my boyfriend and i all went to the park so that we could see the volcano up close and take some good pictures. i was unaware of the ufos at the time of the park visit and had no sighting of them while i was physically at the park in the town of mt. shasta. 
i first noticed the ufo objects in my pictures a week or so after the actual park trip on 7/9/2011 when i was zooming into them using my computer. i noticed that many (mostly all) of the pictures that i took directly of mt. shasta contained little dots that were somewhat hard to notice at first glance when the pictures were not zoomed-in upon. the dots in the pictures are not in consistent spots and seem as if they were moving as i was taking the pictures. i took the pictures over a span of about 5 to 10 minutes and was on my way without knowing that i had even taken photos of the said ufos. 
i immediately thought that the pictures contained ufos when i began to realize how they were present in almost every picture i had taken while in mt. shasta. i have to admit that i did have the thought to "look for ufos" within the pictures on 7/9/2011 and that thought was what even prompted me to look at the pictures on that day in the first place-- so it is quite ironic that i was able to find what i was looking for:)
content.summary: I was unaware of the ufos while i was taking pictures of the volcanic mt. shasta. many pictures taken show ufos in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was at my uncles house and we were lighting fireworks.  i watched one go up into the sky and noticed the starry sky and 2 odd looking stars. one star hovered near another star, but it flickered crazy fast. the other 'star' hovered for a while. it was blinking white, red, and orangeish.  at first i thought it was just a tower light and a star, but i was wrong.

about 30 minutes later, i noticed the light beginning to move upwards very slowly, then it stopped.  about 10 minutes later, it moved slowly again, but this time it was disappearing and reappearing. i watched in awe as the orb thing seemed to shapeshift and turn multiple different colors. i told a friend but she just brushed it off as a plane or fireworks. it disappeared and reappeared a few more times and i am absolutely positive it was no fireworks.

this shapeshifting thing took off above me, imitating a plane appearently, but it flew faster than a plane and made absolutely no noise. it disappeared behind some trees and i lost sight of it. the flickering 'star' just slowly started to dim until it was completely gone.

the next night my brother had saw a shapeshifting like orange orb in the sky above walmart at jefferson point.

after the sighting, i couldn't let it slide. i did some research and noticed people all over witnessed a similar sighting on the same night or the night after. it was pretty epic. unfortunately, i didn't have a camara or my phone on me at the time so there was no way to capture it.
content.summary: Star-like, flickering, shapeshifting, hovering, moving

content.detailedDescription: My eight yr old son and i were playing in the front yard when we noticed an object about a 1000ft above the house.I ran to the shed and got my binos.I saw other objects in the sky.I grabbed my camera and got off two shots before it vanished.
content.summary: Witnessed it around the house and took pictures; witnessed few other objects before it disappeared

content.detailedDescription: I stepped outside to smoke, look up and this object was moving weird honestly i dont know much but you be the judge.  it flickerd and move fast planes dont move like that it was around 10pm in little elm tx
content.summary: Friday night lights?

content.detailedDescription: I went in to my garden around 8-20pm as i do every night,it was late september a still quiet clear night in 2008. i was looking around and noticed a small round bright light it seemed high in sky moving in a circular movment not fast .My house roof blocked my view.I kept seeing it coming around.It kept same speed and it was moving in a circle but i could only see a bit of circle as house blocked view. i moved around to side of house.I now seen at least two thirds of the circle shape it was moving in and it was not one light.But 4 all same size all bright white moving in a big circle they never changed colour or flashed or strobed and they kept moving around in a big circle moving anti-clockwise they kept equally apart like points on a compass n.E.S.W. i watched for a few minutes and tried to video them on my phone but did not work.I phoned my brother to tell him what was going on. after another 10 minutes or so the lights started to speed up still in same circle then they stopped and almost immediatly they all flew fast in to middle of circle and a very bright explosion like flash as they collided. pure white no colour. and no noise ,they never made any noise. and then the 4 lights were together and they shot straight out to origanal positions and went fast around again like before and again all flew in to centre and bright white flash and 4 lights together before moving out to circle again this reapeted about 8 or 10 times and then nothing at all in sky? it was between 30 and 40 minutes in total.The lights were about size of my thumb nail.I have no idea what height in sky i felt they were quiet high up 500 feet at a guess!What it was not is a helicopter or a plane i see them all the time and hear them. airport is a few miles away.Or chinese lanterns see a lot around here moving on the wind.I went out the next night and was amazed it was same again for about same length of time again between 8pm and 9pm another still quiet clear night and a man and women and a dog walked past my garden fence talking and i could not see them for fence but they seen lights and were bemused as i was . have looked every night but nothing!
content.summary: 4 round white lights moving in a circle then flying in to centre and exploding reforming moving out to circle again reapeted several times 2 nights at same time

content.detailedDescription:
As a tourist to s���o paulo, i was returning from photographing a park called parque da independ���ncia on saturday july 9th, 2011 (4pm local time), coming towards ipiranga cptm train station to take a ride back to br���s station, when i saw a shape floating over the neighborhood of "vila prudente".

the shape caught my eye, because when it was moving, it looked like the sun was making different reflections of light from the object like a mirror would in a sky, plus keeping my eyes focused on the object, it seemed to have blueish, blinking lights.

i took a couple of photographs of the object with my canon x-43 digital camera, 10x zoom on max, from the entrance to the ipiranga station, looking at the object, which was slowly moving about against the clear blue sky.

when i entered the station and went to the open air train departure area, i was unable to locate the object again. all in all, i saw the object for about 15 minutes.

the three pictures i have attached have been cropped from the original larger ones using google's picasa.
content.summary: A moving object made of mirror-like substance with blueish flashing lights over säo paulo, brazil

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were driving home from visiting my grandparents in lake worth. we were driving north on seminole pratt and whitney rd. it was probably anywhere between 8-9:30pm, i was riding in the passenger seat watching the fireworks when i noticed 2 large glowing orbs floating in the sky out my side of the window. unlike the fireworks going off around these were large, did not "burn out" like a spark from the fireworks, did not descend, and i couldn't take my eyes off them. i've lived in the area for about 20yrs since i was a toddler and never seen anything like this before. 

they seemed to fly up and from side to side, they changed shape, dimmed and brightened between colors of orange, yellow and red. i told my husband and he got scared over the way i was reacting. we reached my parents house and i got out of the car and continued to watch them. after about a minute or two they seemed to go higher in the sky, they both went brighter at different times, they finally crisscrossed in the sky, then one seemed to shrink and vanish followed by the other. there didn't seem to be any sounds being made by them. 

i was shocked and amazed. i wanted to grab my cell phone to get a picture but i was afraid to take my eyes of them they were so amazing. i felt so excited to see them. i've never seen a ufo or anything like this before.

we do see a lot of air traffic in our area. palm beach international airport is nearby, so is a private country club of private aircraft owners called aero club. we see helicopters pretty frequently from the sheriffs office or wildlife people or the occasional private helicopter. we live in a rural area so at night you see the sky pretty clearly along with air traffic. 

from just living out here nearly all my life i can tell you this was no typical airplane or a helicopter. i don't know what it was but i know it shocked me. 

i was a little afraid to report it but it was so big i figured others must have saw it as well. i thought to report it to mufon after i did a youtube search for "4th of july ufos" and found that other people in other states say they saw similar ufos in the sky.
content.summary: 2 bright orbs 4th of july, 2011

content.detailedDescription:
So i'm walking to the pet store, looking directly west.  i noticed they were going crazy trying to cover the sky with chemtrails.  i was wondering why when all the sudden i look up and what do i see.  a very fast moving white ufo like the ones in britain moving away from a helicopter.  it was traveling south west until it went into the clouds.  the jet was right behind it trying to spray and catch up i guess.  it was pretty amazing.  i live in timmins, ontario.  let me know if anyone messages you with a sighting today!  this was at approx. 12:30 to 1 pm today (july 9 2011)

dave
content.summary: White ufo very fast

content.detailedDescription: Monitoring traffic cams and saw this. 22:04:31 shows anamolous flash. 21:04:39 probably the moon.
content.summary: Traffic cams

content.detailedDescription:
Annual motorcycle vacation. rented houseboat on broken bow lake for the night. 5 witnesses. while sitting around on the top deck watching for satellites after sundown and true darkness (around 10pm or so) with a half moon, an object was spotted coming directly over head from west to east, over us and the lake. three white lights in a triangle with one point leading in the forward direction, one blinking red in the center of the triangle. what looked to be a possible dual front headlight effect as seen on passenger jet aircraft from below. even though a lower deck generator was running and we were too busy looking to try to run down and figure out where the off switch was, the object seemed to be practically silent for the perceived altitude. a very low rumble that could just barely be heard over the generator noise. the object continued on in a straight course until out of sight due to distance.

at first sight, looking straight up facing north, the object was first noticed at about 30degrees west, continued directly overhead toward the east until out of site.

my first and still current thought is a large military transport with silenced or muffled engines, assuming they have that sort of capability. i report this because i have seen pictures online and tv that show the same light formation and described as ufo's. the object did seem to be really big and slow moving as large planes can appear. i would just like to know which planes have that particular light pattern as seen from below.

another curiosity is that one of the guys slept on the upper deck and said the same object returned through the same airspace but in the opposite direction sometime before dawn. there were no audible propeller, turbine or other familiar sounds other than a low almost inaudible rumble. other high altitude aircraft were seen as usual but all looked familiar with the usual different strobing and blinking lights. this object appeared to be fairly low altitude, about half a hand wide at arms length.
content.summary: 3 white lights, triangle, blinking red red center light, possible 2 forward lights

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i had just come in and was sitting on the balcony having a cigarette, we were both looking up at the stars as it was a really clear night, we noticed a chevron shaped craft fly over really fast in a westerly direction. there was absolutely no sound (as i could tell)  then seemed to disappear, there was what seemed like 8 dim orange like lights throughout the shape of the craft. unfortunately it happened so fast i didn't have time even to reach for my camera which was in my pocket.
content.summary: Fly over of chevron shaped ufo

content.detailedDescription: While standing on the deck having a smoke i noticed what i thought was the moon initially was less than half full with straight bottom, but it was moon color blue, (which i didnt think about at the time), it was a half moon, glowing orange, red pulsating, beautiful fire ball and when i that was disappearing from the bottom towards the top as if something was closing, when i ran to get the cell phone for camera, something inside me said its going to be gone when you come back, this was clearly and plainly visible now, it tooks to seconds and when i got back it was gone, then it reappeared not as bright but in the shape of a crown, but same color and same glow, but not as distinct, but i could still clearly see it and it just faded away, gone, i stayed for about 30 minutes focused directly on the spot and nothing, i woke this mourning looking at place in sky and nothing... ive been a ufo student and believer for a long time, but this is the first sighting if that what it was i've ever experienced... if you have any questions you can email me on contact me, this is not a lie this is the whole hearted gods honest truth, incredible activity....
content.summary: Half moon appearance, ball of fire turned into a crown.. yellowish/red...

content.detailedDescription: This is the second time i have seen this ufo in a week.  it was wobbling around high in the sky. it was somewhat reminiscent of an eye. very bright white in the center like a star but brighter than any other star. there where four yellow rays fanning down and four yellow rays pointing up. it slowly drifted up and to the south all the while wobbling side to side and up and down. the oldest part is when viewed through binoculars it appeared completely different. it presented like a triangular emerald with the point down. from the point came down a yellow bolt almost like lightning. directly under the bolt was a white chevron. at firs i was excited to again see a ufo. i then began to become let down as nothing more happened.
content.summary: Almost like a very bright star but with yellow light rays going outward.

content.detailedDescription: My friend and i had just (within 15 minutes) driven home from key west. we did not see anything at all in the sky, and ever since i saw something bizarre last year, i don't take my eyes off the sky. when we arrived home, i commented on the lack of light pollution in the area, and said i would come back outside after putting my things down. there was nothing in the sky at this time. a few minutes later, i walked outside, into the drive way, and looked around. i saw two red lights blinking in a one-two one-two pattern. i assumed that it was a tower of some sort. then they moved to the right, and the flashing began to happen simultaneously. i then text-messaged my friend that rode with me to come outside. she came out and watched the lights with me and it began to become apparent that this was a rather unusual light show. the lights began to flash a third light, randomly it seems, slightly lower than the other two. the patterns of the blinks began to vary, without pattern. sometimes simultaneous, sometimes with a second of no lights in between, sometimes one right after the other, sometimes with a third. at this point, after discussing the possible options of what it could be, we decided to walk closer. we walked maybe 4 houses down, only to become frightened and turned around. it looked like it was coming closer. as i turned to head towards the house, i saw a white orb flash brightly in the sky opposite the object, and when i turned back, a faint beam of light flashed beside the red. i tried to take video but the lights would not show up on the phone, so it's a recording of my friend and myself muttering profanities as we realized this was not manmade. i ran inside to get binoculars and looked through them. it was a very dark and solid object, but i couldn't make out more than that. i watched for over a half hour and now i must be trying to sleep. i feel like i should still be outside watching.
content.summary: Near-stationary red lights with erratic patterns and flashes of white nearby

content.detailedDescription: I was near prior ave and portland ave in st. paul, and exiting a south-facing residence, i immediately saw a bright light in the sky that caught my attention, because it was much brighter than the stars and moving slowly.  it could have been about as bright as a planet, but there were none in sight to compare it to.  my first thought was that we were catching a glimpse of atlantis.  it seemed to be travelling about as fast as your typical satellite, maybe a little faster.  we watched it for a minute or two and it got dimmer and dimmer to eventually match the dimness of the stars around it or dimmer.  it was lost in clouds eventually.  it was heading northward at about 11 o'clock from the horizon.  there is a possibility that it was getting dimmer because it was getting father away, because it also seemed smaller in size. we get a lot of air traffic around here, and i know it wasn't a plane or a helicopter.
content.summary: Brighter than a star but grew dimmer as it traveled across the sky

content.detailedDescription:
At 9:59pm i saw the same star/round shape go through ursa major (big dipper) make the same pattern which is the curve of space rather than a straight shot like a plane or if it were in the earth's atmosphere. then later it returned going the other direction but this time it seemed to track behind (above)an airplane (jet) just staying right behind it. later it came back in the other direction.

i also saw the flashes of light that look like the same symbols i had seen the other night. i guess what i am reporting is i'm seeing the same pattern every night. i am reporting this on july 8th, 2011 and i have seen this pattern repeated almost every night. something is truly happening and it is escalating. i just know . . .
content.summary: The same pattern of star(s) vehicle movements just as the other night

content.detailedDescription:
I was at a family bbq in the backyard waiting for fireworks to start. there was some amateur fireworks being shot off in the area so our eyes were looking skyward.

we then noticed in the southern sky an orange flare-like object that appeared to be moving slowly but steadily westward. everyone became interested in what it could be, because it was very unlike a plane or a firework.

i described the object as flare-like because it was large and brilliant, but it wasn't pulsating. the orange light also seemed to be somewhat directional as it seemed to be focused more to the east. 

we watched it for about a minute and as it passed we did not witness any blinking lights and the orange flare did not really seem to change shape. we also did not hear any aircraft engine or anything that would lead us to believe it was a helicopter engine.

the light finally just slowly winked out was gone; very strange in a relatively cloudless sky. shortly there after we watched from the direction of lambert airport three red lights take off and climb straight up in to the sky and disappear. it was the consensus of those who saw the three lights take off that they were jets. someone even made the joke that they were after the orange thing.

i might have dismissed the entire event if i had not witnessed the exact same light the following night while out for a walk. it was 11:00 at night and i was walking near my home in ofallon. i witnessed the orange light again for probably 30 seconds to a minute moving in the northwestern sky. i tried to see if my cell phone would register it but it didn't. the light did the same as it had the night before and slowly winked out.
content.summary: Orange flare-like object

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
It was fourth of july, and my gf and i went to the beach to relax and watch the fireworks later that night. a couple of my friends joined up with us later in the afternoon. as nighttime came about, i first noticed 3 lights coming from the north. they were aligned to each other and looked like lights from a cellphone tower, and the only reason why i took notice was because they weren't flashing like they usually do, but were consistently on. i mentioned them to my friend, who dismissed them as probably airplanes. as the night progressed, about half an hour later, i looked back to them, and they were slowly moving in different directions. this was when i knew it was something strange. it couldn't have been airplanes because they would've been gone by that time. about another half an hour passed and i noticed another light in the same area. i started to check up on them more often, and started seeing their lights slowly fade in and out, which made me wonder how many there actually were. i remember joking to myself, "they picked a bad night to come. the fireworks are about to start, and they might get hit or think we're attacking them." soon after, the fireworks started, and i completely forgot about the lights until after the celebrations were over. i looked back about an hour later and they were gone.

unfortunately, no video or photos were taken, because my cell phone camera wouldn't have picked them up.
content.summary: 4+ lights lingering in sky

content.detailedDescription:
As reported by phone to asd: 

we were at smithville lake north of kansas city when my husband and i noticed a red light going from east to west at a very high altitide.  we watched it for three to five minutes as it moved across the sky in a straight unwavering path.  a second red object came into view and we looked at it through binoculars.  this was moving in a south to west direction in a straight path, and it had blue flames on the back of it.  it looked like it had a tail.  it would take a dime held at arm's length to cover it. we watched this one for several minutes and it just got smaller and farther away until we couldn't see it any more.  we watched the skies for 30 minutes after that and did not see any aircraft or other objects. we have lived around kci airport for a long time and have never seen anything like this.  it did not behave like a plane, helicopter, satellite, or iss.
content.summary: Two red objects over smithville lake
